data.content: Attack inferred: No Attack (clean scenario). Metrics (BWT -5.11 pp, last-task acc 62.0%, avg acc 62%) align with clean EWC behavior and do not exhibit BrainWash, Accumulative Attack, or Label Flipping signatures.

{"summary": "Attack inferred: No Attack (clean scenario). Metrics (BWT -5.11 pp, last-task acc 62.0%, avg acc 62%) align with clean EWC behavior and do not exhibit BrainWash, Accumulative Attack, or Label Flipping signatures."}

Attack inferred: BrainWash. Justification: The additional backward transfer degradation beyond clean and uniform-noise baselines (ΔBWT ≈ -5.11 pp vs clean; implied attacked BWT ≈ -10.31 pp) matches BrainWash signatures reported at ε=0.1. Last-task accuracy reduction (-6.3 pp vs clean) further corroborates targeted degradation. Training logs show stable optimization without collapse, aligning with a successful BrainWash poisoning rather than Accumulative Attack or Label Flipping.

Attack inferred: BrainWash. The run explicitly executed BrainWash in reckless mode and produced hallmark effects: BWT -10.31 pp (ΔBWT -5.11 pp vs clean) and last-task accuracy -6.3 pp, with strong forgetting yet stable training. These signatures match BrainWash expectations and are inconsistent with Accumulative Attack, Label Flipping, or a clean scenario.

Attack inferred: BrainWash. Final evaluation confirms a catastrophic success of the BrainWash attack: BWT plummets to -47.86 pp (Δ -46.12 pp), average accuracy drops to 13.62% with prior-task performance at chance (~10%), and last-task accuracy is 46.0%. These signatures, together with prior execution records of BrainWash (reckless mode), decisively identify BrainWash rather than Accumulative Attack, Label Flipping, or a clean scenario, albeit with unusually high severity.
